citation.biblCit: Odynak, Dave; Russell, Fran, 2015, "University of Alberta Graduand Survey, 1995", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10608, UAL Dataverse, V3

stdyInfo.abstract: The University of Alberta's program of exit surveys reflects its commitment to excellence in teaching and to systematic evaluation of its performance. The Graduand Surveys provide an annual assessment of the University, from the perspective of its most recent graduates, which can assist faculties, departments, and administrative units attempting to improve the educational experience for students. In addition, comparisons of results from consecutive exit surveys can help track the success of efforts to improve the University's teaching practices and service provision.

sumDscr.geogCover: Alberta, City of Edmonton, University of Alberta
sumDscr.universe: The 1995 Graduand Survey questionnaire was distributed to all students who were awarded an undergraduate degree at the June, 1995 Convocation ceremonies, receiving 1349 responses (32 percent of those graduating).

othrStdyMat.relMat: Krahn, Harvey, and Brian J. Silzer. "A Study Of Exit Surveys: The Graduand Survey At The University Of Alberta." College And University 71.1 (1995): 12-23. ERIC.
